common_issues.title: PiecesOS Connection Loss on Windows
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing connection issues with PiecesOS on Windows, particularly when adding folders to context. This issue appears to be related to specific Windows builds. The Pieces team is actively investigating and consolidating these reports. Users are encouraged to check for duplicate issues and provide log files for further assistance.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App - Lost Connection to PiecesOS
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop App - Lost Connection to PiecesOS
_PiecesOS Information_

**ID:** 1e54a5eb-e233-4925-8202-979176c41cab
**User:** 406a36fe-fe49-42fe-98b3-72a6bc66058c
**Current Version:** Unknown
**Min Version Supported:** 11.0.0
**Max Version Supported:** 12.0.0
**Local Port:** 127.0.0.1:39300

_Device Information_

**Operating System:** Windows
**Current Version:** "Windows 10 Home Single Language" 10.0 (Build 26100)
**Min Version Supported:** Windows 10 Build 1903

#### When I try to add a folder to the context, PiecesOS crashes.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b10af547-e88d-4694-9251-9bcad71712c7

## Conversation Summary:

**Issue:** Users are experiencing a connection issue with PiecesOS. This issue has already been reported in another thread (#536).

**Key Points:**

* **Date:** December 19, 2024
* **Users affected:** @Sujeet76, @sirius-beck, and possibly others
* **Symptoms:** Loss of connection to PiecesOS
* **Related Issues:** #531, #456, #421
* **Resources:** Existing Issues, Documentation, YouTube Channel

**Solutions:**

* Pieces team is working on a fix.
* Sam is investigating a potential fix and requests log files from affected users.
* Mark suggests sending the latest log files instead of all logs.
* Sujeet76 provides the most recent log files.

**Current Status:**

* Issue is being tracked in #536.
* A solution is being developed.
* Users are encouraged to join a Google Meet for further discussion.

**Outcome:**

* The conversation has been moved to issue #536 where the discussion will continue.

**Additional Notes:**

* Mark suggests sending the latest log files.
* Mark provides a link to a Google Meet for further discussion.

When adding folder, tried on both claude 3.5 and gpt 4o (cloud), pieces OS is crashing (lost connection to PiecesOS screen is shown)
Adding specific file does work though.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: 

**Key Points:**

* User reported lost connection to PiecesOS.
* User was directed to related issues and resources.
* Issue was marked as a duplicate of another issue (#536).
* The reported build of Windows seems to be affected.
* Pieces team is actively investigating the issue.

**Problems:**

* User experienced lost connection to PiecesOS.
* This issue appears to be specific to a certain build of Windows.

**Solutions:**

* Pieces team is actively investigating the issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue is closed as a duplicate of another issue (#536).
* The Pieces team is working on a solution.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user was provided with links to relevant resources, including existing issues, documentation, and the YouTube channel.

## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key points raised:**

* Rafael reported an issue with Copilot where it was unable to function properly.
* Mark confirmed the issue and requested steps to reproduce.
* Mark also inquired if Rafael was adding a folder as context to Copilot.

**Problems identified:**

* Copilot was not functioning properly.
* The root cause of the issue was unclear.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mark linked a duplicate ticket (#541) and closed this issue.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue has been consolidated in ticket #541.
* The solution/resolution is not specified in this conversation thread.

**Additional notes:**

* The pieces-support-bot provided helpful resources in the meantime.

common_issues.title: LLM Copilot Errors and Rate Limiting
common_issues.description: Users reported errors when using the PiecesOS Copilot, including empty responses and "Something went wrong" messages. These errors were often related to rate limiting. Solutions included switching LLM models, signing into Pieces, and updating to the latest PiecesOS version with increased rate limits and improved error messages.

related_issues.title: "This message exceeded the context limit for this LLM. Please select a different LLM and try again, or shorten your prompt." issue
related_issues.text:
"This message exceeded the context limit for this LLM. Please select a different LLM and try again, or shorten your prompt." issue
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I wanted to demo the power of pieces using the day one challenge of advent of code.

I received an error that the messages exceeded the context:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9c170105-22d6-4ccb-99f7-650f87357eda)

I tried in a new chat and is started working as expected:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ebb0dfa9-a246-4ade-a8a8-c21723db07e0)

Logs:
pOS: [log-12032024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17993900/log-12032024.txt)
PfD: [log-12032024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17993911/log-12032024.txt)

Here is the complete message for reproduction:
```
Can you give a short plan on how to implement this:
--- Day 1: Historian Hysteria ---

The Chief Historian is always present for the big Christmas sleigh launch, but nobody has seen him in months! Last anyone heard, he was visiting locations that are historically significant to the North Pole; a group of Senior Historians has asked you to accompany them as they check the places they think he was most likely to visit.

As each location is checked, they will mark it on their list with a star. They figure the Chief Historian must be in one of the first fifty places they'll look, so in order to save Christmas, you need to help them get fifty stars on their list before Santa takes off on December 25th.

Collect stars by solving puzzles. Two puzzles will be made available on each day in the Advent calendar; the second puzzle is unlocked when you complete the first. Each puzzle grants one star. Good luck!

You haven't even left yet and the group of Elvish Senior Historians has already hit a problem: their list of locations to check is currently empty. Eventually, someone decides that the best place to check first would be the Chief Historian's office.

Upon pouring into the office, everyone confirms that the Chief Historian is indeed nowhere to be found. Instead, the Elves discover an assortment of notes and lists of historically significant locations! This seems to be the planning the Chief Historian was doing before he left. Perhaps these notes can be used to determine which locations to search?

Throughout the Chief's office, the historically significant locations are listed not by name but by a unique number called the location ID. To make sure they don't miss anything, The Historians split into two groups, each searching the office and trying to create their own complete list of location IDs.

There's just one problem: by holding the two lists up side by side (your puzzle input), it quickly becomes clear that the lists aren't very similar. Maybe you can help The Historians reconcile their lists?

For example:

3   4
4   3
2   5
1   3
3   9
3   3
Maybe the lists are only off by a small amount! To find out, pair up the numbers and measure how far apart they are. Pair up the smallest number in the left list with the smallest number in the right list, then the second-smallest left number with the second-smallest right number, and so on.

Within each pair, figure out how far apart the two numbers are; you'll need to add up all of those distances. For example, if you pair up a 3 from the left list with a 7 from the right list, the distance apart is 4; if you pair up a 9 with a 3, the distance apart is 6.

In the example list above, the pairs and distances would be as follows:

The smallest number in the left list is 1, and the smallest number in the right list is 3. The distance between them is 2.
The second-smallest number in the left list is 2, and the second-smallest number in the right list is another 3. The distance between them is 1.
The third-smallest number in both lists is 3, so the distance between them is 0.
The next numbers to pair up are 3 and 4, a distance of 1.
The fifth-smallest numbers in each list are 3 and 5, a distance of 2.
Finally, the largest number in the left list is 4, while the largest number in the right list is 9; these are a distance 5 apart.
To find the total distance between the left list and the right list, add up the distances between all of the pairs you found. In the example above, this is 2 + 1 + 0 + 1 + 2 + 5, a total distance of 11!

Your actual left and right lists contain many location IDs. What is the total distance between your lists?
```
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* An issue was identified where empty responses were received from the LLM (Claude 3.5 Sonnet) through the Pieces API.
* This occurred infrequently and was difficult to reproduce. 
* The issue was traced to empty outputs being returned by Vertex AOT ("internal error on the google side").

**Problems Identified:**

* Empty responses from the LLM caused confusion and hampered debugging.
* The root cause of the empty responses was unclear.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Change the error message to reflect the actual cause and suggest solutions (switch models or retry).
* Investigate the root cause of empty responses from Vertex AOT.
* Update to the latest release of os server (11.0.0) which includes a potential fix.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue seems to be resolved with the latest os server release. Further testing is recommended.

**Additional Notes:**

* @sam-at-pieces recommends reaching out to Vertex support if the issue persists.
* @hra42 is investigating the issue further and may have additional information to share.

**Overall:**

This conversation highlights the importance of clear error messages and the need for collaboration between developers and cloud service providers to resolve issues effectively.

related_issues.title: Bug: Claude 3.5 Sonnet Copilot response issues "I'm Sorry something went wrong with the processing..."
related_issues.text:
Bug: Claude 3.5 Sonnet Copilot response issues "I'm Sorry something went wrong with the processing..."
### Software

Copilot Module

### Operating System / Platform

macOS, Windows, Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hey 👋,

We are experiencing some issues on and off w/ Claude Sonnet 3.5 within the Copilot Modules of all the applications.

If you are experiencing this issue please first:
1. change the Model runtime to OpenAI or Gemini as these are working very consistently.
2. Ensure you sign in to the Pieces Ecosystem, this will ensure that you have a larger rate limit than those users who are NOT authenticated.

Please feel free to comment in this thread if you are experiencing similar issues!


## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points:**

- User @mark-at-pieces created an issue that was automatically triaged by the Pieces-support-bot.
- The bot provided some initial information and helpful resources, including related issues and documentation.
- The bot estimated a follow-up within 24 hours.

**Problems Identified:**

- The specific nature of the issue reported by @mark-at-pieces is not available in the provided conversation excerpt.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

- The bot suggested relevant existing issues that might help the user.
- The bot provided links to documentation, YouTube channel, and the existing issues list.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

- The issue is being reviewed and will be addressed by the Pieces team within 24 hours.
- No further updates are available in the provided excerpt.

**Additional Information:**

- The conversation took place on December 18, 2024, at 16:10:36 UTC.

related_issues.title: I´m sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please wait a few seconds and try again, or contact support@pieces.app
related_issues.text:
I´m sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please wait a few seconds and try again, or contact support@pieces.app
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.13

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

[com.pieces.pfd.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17891327/com.pieces.pfd.zip)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c9a6f930-4d30-41ad-8d70-b81d9c3f7e6f)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/99d91958-8fb7-4f27-9efa-9d628127e90f)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8d1c630b-816c-488d-87f9-202a86d63820)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8e8278a0-eca0-4b4e-bcaa-a5b195da5562)

## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users were experiencing an error message when using the PiecesOS copilot.
* The error was related to rate limiting implemented by PiecesOS.
* Users were able to resolve the issue by contacting a developer and providing logs or attending a scheduled call.
* A new version of PiecesOS was released with increased rate limits and improved error messages.

**Problems Identified:**

* Rate limiting was causing issues for users.
* Lack of clear error messages made troubleshooting difficult.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Developers increased rate limits manually for affected users.
* Improved error messages were added to the copilot.
* A new version of PiecesOS was released with increased rate limits and improved error messages.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is resolved for most users.
* Users encountering the issue should update to the latest version of PiecesOS and retry. If the issue persists, they can contact the developer via the provided link.

**Additional Notes:**

* Authentication will be required for cloud processing in the future.
* The developer expressed appreciation for user feedback and collaboration.

**Overall:**

The developer proactively addressed the rate limiting issue and implemented solutions to prevent future occurrences. The new version of PiecesOS with improved error messages enhances user experience and facilitates troubleshooting.

common_issues.title: Copilot Processing Error in Pieces OS
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing "Something went wrong with processing" errors in the Copilot module, primarily with Claude 3.5. This is often due to rate limiting. Solutions include authenticating with Pieces Ecosystem for higher rate limits, using alternative models like OpenAI or Gemini, or updating to the latest Pieces OS version.

related_issues.title: I can't use any GPT models other than 'GPT-4o Mini'
related_issues.text:
I can't use any GPT models other than 'GPT-4o Mini'
### Software

Desktop Application, JetBrains, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

"I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please wait a few seconds and try again, or contact support@pieces.app"

If the model is 4o Mini, everything works fine.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User int80x0 reported an issue with Copilot showing the message "I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please wait a few minutes and try again."
* The issue was categorized as a common problem that might be resolved with PiecesOS 11.0.0.

**Problems Identified:**

* Rate limiting issue potentially resolved by authentication.
* Potential issue with conversation flow.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Authenticating the user to address potential rate limiting.
* Referencing previous issue #471 for further troubleshooting.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue was closed and marked as a duplicate of #471.
* Users are encouraged to review the previous issue for further information and solutions.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Connection Loss on Windows
common_issues.description: Users on Windows (Build 26100) experience "Lost Connection to PiecesOS" errors, particularly when adding folders. This might be due to corrupted files in the user's Documents folder. Solutions include reinstalling the app after deleting the 'com.pieces.os' and 'com.pieces.pfd' folders or contacting support for database repair.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App - Lost Connection to PiecesOS
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop App - Lost Connection to PiecesOS
_PiecesOS Information_

**ID:** 18986c5c-5aef-40f4-ac00-93da40fd8b47
**User:** 1446bb64-5370-4644-a0ee-5ab3b4f3a7ac
**Current Version:** Unknown
**Min Version Supported:** 11.0.0
**Max Version Supported:** 12.0.0
**Local Port:** 127.0.0.1:39300

_Device Information_

**Operating System:** Windows
**Current Version:** "Windows 10 Pro" 10.0 (Build 26100)
**Min Version Supported:** Windows 10 Build 1903

Pieces for developers always loosing connection and self closing pieces OS
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points:**

* User `rafael-a-g-n` reported an issue with Pieces OS disconnecting and restarting frequently.
* The issue seemed to be related to an outdated version of the software and the presence of corrupted files in the user's Documents folder.

**Problems identified:**

* Pieces OS disconnecting and restarting repeatedly.
* Reinstalling Pieces OS without deleting the Documents folder did not resolve the issue.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* **Solution 1 (by `rafael-a-g-n`):**
    1. Uninstall both Pieces OS and For Developers applications.
    2. Delete the `com.pieces.os` and `com.pieces.pfd` folders from the user's Documents folder.
    3. Reinstall Pieces OS and For Developers applications.
* **Solution 2 (by `mack-at-pieces`):**
    * Connect with Pieces support to repair the database if users want to keep their code snippets and Copilot chats.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue appears to be resolved for `rafael-a-g-n` after following Solution 1.
* `mack-at-pieces` provided additional information for users who might want to retain their data.
* A patch was released to handle alternative installation locations gracefully.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS crashes on Windows when adding context
common_issues.description: Users on Windows experience crashes with PiecesOS (versions 10.1.15 and 11.0.0) when adding files or folders as context. The issue seems to affect multiple Windows versions. The Pieces team is actively investigating these crashes and gathering information to debug and resolve the problem.

related_issues.title: Bug: Adding Folder as context (typescript repo) appears to crash PiecesOS within the Copilot
related_issues.text:
Bug: Adding Folder as context (typescript repo) appears to crash PiecesOS within the Copilot
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hey 👋,

We are tracking down an issue right now on Windows w/ regard to Typescript folders crashing PiecesOS on 11.0.0.

So far we are unable to reproduce this behavior on Macos, but are still looking deeper into this issue in the Windows Ecosystem.

Please let us know in this issue if you are experiencing similar behavior on windows or if things are working properly.

Thank you in advance!
## GitHub Issue Summary: Pieces for Developers crashes on Windows 11

**Key Points:**

* The issue is crashing of the Pieces for Developers app on Windows 11 while uploading files and folders.
* The issue appears related to a specific OS build.
* User @mark-at-pieces provided a screenshot of the error message.

**Problems Identified:**

* App crashes on upload attempts.
* Specific OS build may be causing the issue.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces requests users experiencing the issue to provide the information from the screenshot.
* A ticket will be filed and the issue will be further monitored and debugged.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is being investigated and a solution is yet to be implemented. Users are requested to provide additional information to assist with debugging.

## GitHub Conversation Summary: PiecesOS crashing with files/folders context

**Key Points:**

* User omkar-4 reported PiecesOS crashing when using files/folders as context.
* Support bot responded, suggesting related issues and helpful resources.
* Mark, from the Pieces team, acknowledged the issue and requested files/folders for troubleshooting.
* Omkar-4 shared files and a link to the repository.
* Mark marked this issue as a duplicate of another, where updates can be followed.

**Problems:**

* PiecesOS crashes when using files/folders as context.
* This issue is difficult to reproduce for the Pieces team.

**Solutions:**

* User provided the relevant files/folders for debugging.
* User was directed to follow another issue for updates.

**Outcome:**

* The issue was marked as a duplicate and closed.
* Updates can be followed on a related issue.

**Overall:**

The problem was acknowledged by the Pieces team and user provided the required information for further investigation. The user can track progress by following the related issue.

## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key points raised:**

* Rafael reported an issue with Copilot where it was unable to function properly.
* Mark confirmed the issue and requested steps to reproduce.
* Mark also inquired if Rafael was adding a folder as context to Copilot.

**Problems identified:**

* Copilot was not functioning properly.
* The root cause of the issue was unclear.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mark linked a duplicate ticket (#541) and closed this issue.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue has been consolidated in ticket #541.
* The solution/resolution is not specified in this conversation thread.

**Additional notes:**

* The pieces-support-bot provided helpful resources in the meantime.

recommendations: **Prioritize 'PiecesOS Connection Loss on Windows' Issue:** This issue is highly frequent and affects a specific Windows build. Focus on identifying the root cause and providing a permanent fix.  Consider reaching out to users on the affected build for more information.

**Improve Error Messaging for Copilot Issues:**  The frequent 'Something went wrong with processing' error in Copilot is often due to rate limiting. Implement clearer error messages that guide users towards solutions like authentication or model switching.
**Investigate and Address PiecesOS Crashes:** Crashes when adding context are critical and require immediate attention. Gather detailed logs from affected users to expedite debugging and resolution.
**Monitor Specific Windows Build (26100):**  A significant number of issues originate from this build.  Devote resources to testing and ensuring compatibility with this specific version.
**Proactive Communication for Known Issues:** For issues like rate limiting, proactively communicate workarounds and solutions through in-app notifications, FAQs, or release notes.

**Enhance Documentation for LTM and Ollama:** Issues related to Long-Term Memory and Ollama installation suggest a need for clearer documentation. Provide step-by-step guides and troubleshooting tips.
**Gather User Feedback on OSX/Nukesped.ext:** Ticket #543 suggests a potential false positive with VirusBarrier. Investigate this thoroughly and communicate findings to users to maintain trust.
